Nekopara is a beautiful love story between a man and his loyal cats showing him the value of family. It's the kind of light hearted love story that sincere, sensitive, gentle men would enjoy. Married men may want to sit this one out, but I would say it could make you more romantic and appreciative towards your spouse; clingy if you take it too far. And for any female gamers who may be interested in Nekopara: bless you for being able to step into a male protagonist's shoes and understanding.  I can not stress this enough: Nekopara is a heavenly fantasty that leaves you begging for more. Part of you will feel extremely satisfied after completion, but another part of you will be left longing for the warm embrace of a lover. IMO, these are very disirable feelings to have, and can only make you a better, sweeter person.  Nekopara Vol.1 is the first part of an upcoming series. And while the play time is only several hours, I think you may appreciate the low asking price. There is an adults-only version of the game available outside of Steam. You can read the discussion forum FAQ section for more information on where to purchase it.

I've been a fan of Sayori's artwork for years now, and I've waited anxiously for a day that Neko Works would produce some kind of game with her gorgeous artwork. It's finally here, and it's everything you could ask for: HD artwork, fully voiced, and a high quality emofuri-inspired animation engine. Seeing these characters come to life outside of art books and short ero comics gives me huge moe feels.  You should buy this if you obsess over catgirls or are looking for another short VN to play. Pick up the original ero release on DLsite too. :chocola:

Nekopara is one of those feel good games (and I'm not just talking about the sex). The plot is very basic, so it's more about the interactions and conversations the main character has with the cat girls. Every moment is an opportunity for the cat girls to act cute, say cute things, and do cute things.  The graphics are beyond par for this type of game, with incredibly beautiful visuals and details, and impressively animated using Live2D. The vast array of gorgeously frilly lolita inspired clothing will make you constantly fawn over how adorable Chocola and Vanilla look. The character voices are also very good. It's a bit on the trope-y side, but it helps tying it all together in a comfortable familiarity. You'll quickly find your favorite character.  Since this is the first volume, a fair bit of the first few chapters deals with setting the stage, and introducing you to the personalities of all the characters. The 'plot' doesn't really 'pick up' until about half-way through.  One thing I do like about this particular game is the small attention to detail that they've designed. Things like automatically moving the mouse cursor to the center when selecting yes/no for loading/saving. The user interface is intuitive, and the colors are welcoming.  In terms of gameplay, there really is none. It's a non-interactive, visual novel. Don't expect more than that. That's not to say it's a bad thing. It's just to be expected for this kind of game.  If you're thinking about purchasing this game for the sex, you will be disappointed to know that Steam has made the developer completely cut the sexual content. And relatively speaking, that's about 40% of the game! Fortunately, if you google it, you can find an easy to install patch that will restore all the content. So at the very least, buy this game to support the developer!

Your typical self-indulgent moe culture anime VN.  This game is sugary adorable on a lethal level; it really only consists of cute catgirls doing cute catgirl things, and the Unvoiced Self-Projection Protagonist™ being around to observe and deal with it. If you don't mind a pointless, cute slice of life story with sexualized humanoid pets, Nekopara won't bite you; it's altogether harmless in its silliness.  There's not much point to the story other than following along with the catgirls' lives and their growing relationship with ye olde faceless hero. All that's required is clicking away at the dialogue or letting it auto for your leisure since there are no choices, and by extension no routes. You're stuck with the two main kitties, so if you're considering this game with any of the others in mind you may as well not get it. Moreover, the game--while hosting some R18 material--still skips sex scenes, so if you're also more on the lookout for something more explicit this might be too vanilla of an alternative.  But like I said, it's pretty harmless; it's honestly just a box of cat-eared firecrackers exploding into Cute and Euphemisms with a serving of incredibly tedious loli siscon here and there (complete with the occasional ego boost from characters who call you 'Master' and love you unconditionally).  In the end found it fun enough for a short story, but what really kept me around were the smooth movements of the character portraits. Perhaps I was just so mesmerized by the art style, facial expressions and stunning transitions that I just didn't care about anything else. The CGs were nice too, but mate... The portraits MOVE. I know, because you can tell by the unnatural boob jiggles as they just stand around and breathe.  It's with a heavy heart that I declare myself impressed over something like that but you must know that I am two things: weak, and a cat person.  So I suppose what y'all can take from this is, if an asexual like myself can enjoy this game well enough, you probably can too. And hell, if it happens to be up your fap alley, go ahead and proceed, you crazy furries.

Similar to Sakura Spirit; this kind of isn't a game, its more like an book in some aspects. But unlike Sakura Spirit, Nekopara has actually shown some heart and care, and has put in both voice acting and done some very fluid animations for pretty much all scenes.  The steam version has a good chunk of the adult content cut out; but I am told that it is possible to go find the 18+ version elsewhere; if you have the money for both, you can technically combine them so your playing through the steam overlay and getting the achievements, while at the same time getting the hentai content originally created for the game. I imagine the 18+ content was left out for child/family friendliness... or else theres intentions to make it as separate dlc content later on. Don't know.  Also unlike Sakura Spirit, I can actually stand to read what the main character is saying. Not to mention the storyline for Nekopara looks, so far, like it will be far longer than Sakura Spirit, and with a good deal more thought put into it; even if it is sort of more of a 'slice of life' modern day fantasy setting.  Would I recommend this? Yeah, the creators did some good work on this, and theres real quality in it.

It is more than its thematic turbulence that makes NEKOPARA Vol. 1 extraordinary, actually. Excellence abounds at every turn in this open-world role-playing game: excellent exploration, excellent creature design, excellent combat mechanics, excellent character progression. But the moments that linger are those that reveal the deep ache in the world's inhabitants. In one quest, you reunite two lovers, one of which is now a rotting hag, its tongue lasciviously lolling from its mouth. In another, a corpulent spouse-abuser must find a way to love two different lost souls, each of which test the limits of his affection. Don't worry that these vague descriptions spoil important events: they are simple examples of the obstacles every resident faces. On the isles of Neko Paradise and back home with Shigure, there is no joy without parallel sorrow. Every triumph demands a sacrifice. Overall nice cheap porn - 9/11

Surprisingly good game, provided you can get past the fact that it's basically about slavery. The elephant in the room never left for me, but there's a pretty decent level of distraction. That said, it's downright surreal when people in your bakery inquire with anything other than disgust regarding your sexual experiences with what are considered your pets in this game's setting.  The plot is virtually nonexistent. You take these cat-human hybrids as slave labor because your sister is a horrible person and they want to get away from her. They claim to love you in order to do this. However it was all a diabolical plot by your sister to get you laid (or, if it were real life, forever label you with the social stigmata of being a cat-♥♥♥♥er). She actually did this because she couldn't find a way to get in your pants herself. I'm not joking. Literally every character in this game wants to ♥♥♥♥ you.  Back to the topic of cat-♥♥♥♥ing, the H-scenes patch (see community hub) is rather unique because of how the sprites in this game move. If you're into erotica I'd recommend it. I just downloaded it for the full experience and skimmed through most of it, though, because I'm not interested in most pornography. I'm not sure you'd want to play the game without it though. It's kind of difficult to describe my feelings on the subject.  All-in-all, you should definitely play this game if you feel you have no qualms forcing man-made demi-humans into slave labor. Me, I played a lot of RPGs that already touched on that subject (well, aside from the man-made part) when I was younger, so I didn't enjoy that part too much. But a 'romantic' (hot, sexy, erotic) read is worth it.  Also, like most games, this game has trading cards which lets you refund some of the purchase price effectively. If it's on sale, you can probably get it for a net cost of like $3-$4. Which is good enough.

If you like VNs, if you like things that are a bit different, if you like romance stories (I use this 'if' lightly), then you will probably like this game. I laughed at times, was at the verge of tears sometimes, confused at times, was intrigued at times, and I love this game to death.

This game has a good length, but it's deceptively empty. For all the claims of a 'great' story, it's mostly fanservice and build-up. Vol. 1 is an apt part of the title because it definitely doesn't feel complete. I think after finishing the storyline you're definitely going to be crying out, 'BUT WHERE'S THE REST OF IT?', but that alone should tell you it's a pretty good game. I'm disappointed that the story didn't develop as much as I hoped it would, but I can't argue that I was delighted the whole time I was playing due to the colorful characters and the question of where everything was leading (although unsatisfactorily answered). As part of a series this is a great start, but woefully inadequate (especially compared to fantastic FREE novels like Katawa Shoujo) as a standalone VN.   But catgirls are ♥♥♥♥ing cute so 10/10.
